_88onBoardedDate.description: The date on which the associated person completed onboarding.

_88tracker.description: The tracker, if any, associated with this application. This is fixed at the time that application is made.

_88hireDate.description: Per- HR-XML, The date on which the associated person was hired.

$eref.description: Per- HR-XML, the date the employee or human resource actually begins work or enters on duty
Per- HR-XML, The date on which the associated person was hired.
The date on which the associated person completed onboarding.

___amount.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

___typeCode.description: A code classifying the type of remuneration (HR/XML)

_88dutyEntryDate.description: Per- HR-XML, the date the employee or human resource actually begins work or enters on duty

_88since.description: If this application was fetched via a filter, the date-time when the application satisfied the filter (e.g., in a call to GET /applications/at/interview/ever, this would be the date the application first entered the interview phase

___amount.description: The monetary value of the object in which the amount is associated

___typeCode.description: A code classifying the type of remuneration (HR/XML)

_88notifications.description: whether this candidate wants to receive email alerts about new jobs

_88internalFlag.description: whether this candidate is an internal

$eref.description: If this application was fetched via a filter, the date-time when the application satisfied the filter (e.g., in a call to GET /applications/at/interview/ever, this would be the date the application first entered the interview phase

_88shortSummary.description: A short (up to 75 characters) and enticing call to action for candidates for this job

_88templateFlag.description: true if this job is a template, otherwise false/null/not present

_88country.description: a 2 letter country code for the job as per ISO 3166-1 alpha-2

_88title.description: A short phrase describing the position as it would be listed on a business card or in a company directory

_88org.description: the job's org (a value from GET /orgs)

_88code.description: A code, often used in advertisements and when referring to the job opening with candidates. Codes are expected to be unique within currently active job openings. Not in HR/XML

___availableExternally.description: Position is currently open to externals (implies status is active, but callers should check that relevant closeDates are in the future)

___internalPublishDate.description: the date on which the job was published to internal candidates. If not set, use publishDate.

___publishDate.description: the date on which the job was published (became available to candidates)

___externalPublishDate.description: the date on which the job was published to external candidates. If not set, use publishDate.

___availableInternally.description: Position is currently open to internals (implies status is active, but callers should check that relevant closeDates are in the future)

___internalCloseDate.description: the date on which applications from internal candidates are scheduled to close. If not set, closeDate is used.

___closeDate.description: the date on which applications are scheduled to close

___externalCloseDate.description: the date on which applications from external candidates are scheduled to close. If not set, closeDate is used.

_88description.description:
Formatted using a subset (no angle brackets) of markdown with individual lines demarcated with 
.

_88externalId.description: An immutable external identifier, e.g. primary key in an upstream system, used to identify the job

_88accessCode.description: a code that, if held on an incoming tracker, allows the holder to view and apply for the job even if it would otherwise be not visible to them

_88company.description: as per Salesforce, more explicit than org

$eref.description: The tracker, if any, associated with this application. This is fixed at the time that application is made.
